Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the current model: the original process steps are supposed to be in order 1 to 8. But the current model after approving the requisition has a parallel block for steps 3 to 7. The parallel block includes Create Purchase Order, Receive Goods, Receive Invoice, Match Invoice, and Pay Invoice. Thats a problem because those steps shouldnt all be parallel.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The current model has the parallel block after step 2, so all those steps (3-7) can happen in any order. But in reality, theres a sequence. For example, you cant receive goods before creating the purchase order. Also, you cant receive the invoice before creating the PO. The matching step (6) should come after both receiving the invoice and the PO exists. Paying the invoice (7) should only happen after matching (6).

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: After creating the PO, the next steps are: Receive Goods (4) and Receive Invoice (5) might be done in parallel, perhaps? Like, the goods might arrive before the invoice, or vice versa. But the matching step (6) cant happen until both the invoice and the PO are there. The invoice is tied to the PO. So steps 4 and 5 can happen in any order, but both must be done before step6 (Match).

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: After step3 (Create PO), the next steps are: steps 4 and 5 can be in any order, but both must happen. Once both 4 and 5 are done, then you can do step6 (Match). After that, you can do step7 (Pay Invoice), and then close case. So the structure after step3 would be: Sequence of [parallel(4,5) -> 6 ->7 ->8].

Name: Validation - PE
Text: The corrected process tree would be: root = ProcessTree(operator=Operator.SEQUENCE, children=[ create_req, approve_req, create_po, sequence_after_po ]), where sequence_after_po = ProcessTree(operator=Operator.SEQUENCE, children=[ ProcessTree(operator=Operator.PARALLEL, children=[receive_goods, receive_invoice]), match_invoice, pay_invoice, close_case ]). This ensures that after creating the PO, you have the parallel of 4 and5, then the rest in sequence. This way, the parallel block ensures 4 and5 are done before step6.
